channel.title: Paul
channel.description:
A movie about an alien named Paul (voiced by Seth Rogen), which crosses over actors from what I call the 'new frat pack' (the guys who did Forgetting Sarah Marshall, 40 Year Old Virgin, etc), and British actors Simon Pegg and Nick Frost from Hot Fuzz -- you'll notice plenty of other great comedy actors too though. :P
Hilarious film, lots of sci-fi references, and pretty much laugh-a-minute funny.

I watched a few trailers it looks so funny, etc. I liked seeing some alien ass too.

item.title: Paul
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

thepinksock:

I felt the same way as Holic. I was so scared it was gonna suck. It turned out to be hilarious.

I’d understand you having this opinion if it was an all-American cast and crew making the film – they don’t really have integrity, and most trailers from American films now are just barely representative the film. Specifically, they put the entire two minutes of the film that is watchable into the trailer, and the rest of the film is shit.

I had complete faith in the fact that it would be good after I was told that Simon Pegg was in it, though. Britons have a little more integrity, I guess.

Read full topic

item.title: Paul
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:1, topic:391297”]A movie about an alien named Paul (voiced by Seth Rogen), which crosses over actors from what I call the ‘new frat pack’ (the guys who did Forgetting Sarah Marshall, 40 Year Old Virgin, etc), and British actors Simon Pegg and Nick Frost from Hot Fuzz – you’ll notice plenty of other great comedy actors too though.

Hilarious film, lots of sci-fi references, and pretty much laugh-a-minute funny.[/quote]
Yeah i was a bit nervous to see Paul just because Simon Pegg and Nick Frost are always so good together, but this just didnt look like it was going to be up to par with their other films (yano, like when they have Edgar Wright?) but it was a funny ass movie.
I loved it and would definitely see it again.

Read full topic
